title.en: HKSAR statistics on yearly arrivals and departures of V-refugees from 1975–1997
title.zh-hant: 香港特別行政區1975至1997年關於每年抵達及離境越南難民之統計數字

medium.en: acrylic, ink, and oil on vellum and paper
medium.zh-hant: 塑膠彩、水墨及油彩紙本 (厚描圖紙及畫紙)

creditLine.en: M+, Hong Kong. Brown Family Annual Acquisition Fund, 2016
creditLine.zh-hant: M+，香港，Brown家族年度購藏基金購置，2016年

images.altText: Acrylic, ink, and oil painting on vellum and paper depicting a map of Hong Kong drawn in thin, green outlines against a lighter green surface. A timeline along the top of the map shows each year from 1975 to 1997. Each year is connected to a vertical line that runs down to the map directly below. Each line contains circles of different sizes, like beads on a piece of string. Each circle contains smaller circles in tightly knit formations and are either yellow, green, red, or blue in colour. A small colour key in the bottom left corner explains the meaning of each colour, representing either ‘Year-end arrivals’, ‘Year-end repatriation’, ‘Year-end resettlement’ or ‘Year-end population’ for ‘Vietnamese’ and ‘ECVII’. A small pie chart labelled ‘1975–1995 (UNCHR)’ indicates percentages for different regions in Southeast Asia.
